headline: Roast Chicken with Rosemary
description: This rosemary roasted chicken is stuffed with onion and fresh herbs for a simple and delicious baked chicken, just like the ones in Italian markets.

video.description: Watch how to make this Italian-inspired recipe.
video.name: Roast Chicken with Rosemary

name: Roast Chicken with Rosemary

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Season chicken all over with salt and pepper, including cavity. Stuff cavity with onion and rosemary. Place chicken in a 9x13-inch baking dish or roasting pan.

Roast in the preheated oven until chicken is no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, 2 to 2 1/2 hours. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of chicken near the bone should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).

review.reviewBody: Easy and tasty.
Easiest and best tasting ever. Very healthy. Wouldn't change a thing.

I will never roast a whole chicken any other way. simply amazing. I have a bad habit of over doing spices. my food tends to be bold in flavors. this recipe however combines the spices in a way that gives only hints of the flavors. everything married in an amazing way. no single spice overran this dish. love love love it.
This looks amazing. I can’t wait to serve this!
Very good and so easy. The whole house smelled amazing while cooking! I coated chicken with olive oil and baked on a rack. Yum. Simply yum!
20 minutes per pound is the key! Plus 15 minutes to rest!

very good. I read many of the reviews. so I placed butter/rosemary under the skin of the breast and thigh. I placed onion, garlic and rosemary, 1/2 lemon, salt and pepper in the bird. Put olive oil, kosher salt and ground pepper and chopped rosemary on the skin. I roasted breast side down for 30 minutes. then placed red and yukon gold potatoes, sweet potato, onion, carrots and garlic down and chicken back on veg base. used olive oil, salt and pepper over veg. used 14 ounces of chicken stock. I roasted 1 1/2 more hours covered, basting every 30 minutes. then additional 30 minutes uncovered. While chicken rested. I pulled out veg. and made gravy by heating juices and adding cornstarch slurry to thicken. Dear Hubby loved it. Next time, I will add more rosemary. I did not have the 1/4 cup recommended. I had 2 Tablespoons. WE love rosemary.

Very simple recipe. I made slight changes according to other reviewers because I don't make whole chickens very often. I added a garlic clove to the inside and oiled the outside of the chicken before salt and peppering. Cooked at 450 for 15 mins then reduced to 350 for the remaining time. I followed the 20 minutes per pound cooking rule and then let it rest for 20 mins and it was perfect.

Glorious in every way! Don’t forget to baste every 20 minutes or so. It makes a difference! (I follow other reviews suggestions to add lemon and garlic and roast veggies and potatoes along the bottom of the pan with the chicken on a rack.)
It was delicious. I made it according to the recipe, but did used a covered roasting pan instead of broiler. The combination of potatoes, onions and apples was fabulous.

Great flavors, and what could be better than a roasted chicken?! Such a bargain both in cost and effort. I always either make broth afterwards, or freeze the carcass to do so. The chicken gets double duty that way!

The only comment that I would make is that newer thinking based on studies suggest we should not be rinsing our chickens... doesn't really make them more sanitary, but it does through microscopic droplets of chicken juice everywhere in your kitchen. Instead just pat dry and cook.
Date night dinner :-)
It's really delicious...
A terrific simple go to meal. I increased the amt. of fresh rosemary

I added homemade herbes de province, which really put it over the top!
I’m going to make it again tonight!! 
Not to mention the broth the carcass produces makes homemade soups absolutely delicious
i cooked chocked for 1hr in 375 oven. Was very good

Delicious! The carrots were a little under done because I used a roasting pan that was waaaay too big. But the bird came out with crispy skin and tender, moist meat all around. I made a delicious gravy out of the drippings and we could taste the fresh rosemary. Easy and adult & kid approved.
I made this using a larger chicken, but the results were outstanding! I just increased the amount of the other ingredients.
Great recipe will make it again
I watched the video it had more ingredients than it says in the list. It was really really good??
This was good and easy to make. I cooked a 7 pound chicken and it was delicious.
Very good and I will make it again!
Excellent! Very moist and full of flavor. I tried it out in my new convection oven and the skin cooked crispy and perfect!

This was incredible. It fell off the bone and was quite tasty. I pulled it out at an hour 45 and used the juices to baste the rest of the chicken. Then I put it back in for 15 minutes. Was perfectly cooked.

I love this easy recipe. My whole family always give five stars.... 
I made this more than five times...
Awesome! The house smelled so good it was hard to wait for it to be finished. Added lemon to the cavity and potatoes and carrots! in the final hour. So easy
Delicious, plenty of compliments on the meal.
delicious and easy.
The only change I made was to add a little garlic salt. The chicken was falling off the bone tender, and was very good. This was the first chicken I ever roasted, and I will definitely do it again.
very good I love Rosemary and this was easy and good. will make it again
I enjoyed this. I added oranges while roasting the chicken. Looking forward to doing it again.

Excellent, even though I had quarter chicken and did not have rosemary. Substituted with thyme and some tarragon. The chicken meat and vegetables were perfectly cooked and flavorful! Made a little gravy from the drippings, which turned out to be a nice topper to the meal! Looking forward to preparing this meal with the right ingredients next time! Definitely a repeater!
I made two roasted rosemary chickens and they turned out very good!I will definitely make this recipe again!!!
Came out delicious and juicy! I added more rosemary so the flavor really could come through in the meat
Outstanding results. A definite keeper recipe.
I did mix a little olive oil with fresh rosemary, salt and pepper and spread it on the outside of the chicken as well. Was moist, flavorful.
I did mix a little olive oil with fresh rosemary, salt and pepper and spread it on the outside of the chicken as well. Was moist, flavorful.

This is an excellent, easy recipe! First time I followed the recipe exactly with wonderful results. Next time I rubbed Penzey's Fox Pointe Seasoning on the outside too and WOW! Also baked for 3 hrs since I cook these really huge home-grown chickens. Will back on a rack next time.

SO SO SO GOOD! 
I have to say, I have NEVER eaten a chicken drumstick where the meat would literally fall off...
Then again, it depends on your oven. Our landlord was so kind in giving us a new oven that had a convection setting which distributed the air equally. 

Did this for the family and they wanted more.. unfortunately there was none left! haha

I made this with a few adjustments. I mixed olive oil, tbsp paprika, tbsp rosemary, tbsp lemon juice 2 cloves diced garlic, and salt and pepper and rubbed it above and under the skin and in the cavity. Then I put an onion and lemon in the cavity. Cooked an hour and a half. Was so juicy and flavorful
No one liked it!
I cooked this in a toaster oven so I think it cooked faster than regular oven. Nice taste, I just wished the flavors cooked through more. The juices taste good.
This was an OK roast chicken but not particularly flavorful nor moist.
I used tofu and broiled it for 10 min/side. Fabulous
I made this for my family. The first time it was so good they said nothing could make this better. Thanks for such a great recipe!
Good basic recipe. Its best if you use one of the techniques to crisp the skin as others have said.

I did a combination of 2 recipes and the result was juicy, tasty roast chicken that my friends loved! The combination of this and Happy Roast Chicken! It's super fast to prepare, and tasted heavenly. I stuffed the chicken with lemon and rosemary, and rubbed Dijon mustard all over the chicken before roasting it in a pan. It turned out cooked just right!
I also cut up a lemon and added it with the onion and rosemary inside the chicken. I will make it again!
I made this with chicken breasts. It was delicious and I plan to make it again and again.
Loved it. Had so much flavor and no added fat!!
Well I loved it, didn't make any changes, but the husband has decided he's not a rosemary fan... darn!
Delicious. Put carrots, onion, mushrooms, and potatoes. Family loved it.
Delicious as is and soooo easy!
Just awesome. Used this for my Christmas turkey last year, everyone loved it. Have made it with chicken too. Can't fail with this one.

Rubbing the bird with olive oil and adding chopped basil, per another reviewer's suggestion, was great. I too added lemons to the cavity along with onions. Delicious and simple! Company quality for sure!

This recipe is easy, delicious, and my family loved it! I made 2 chickens at once by doubling the recipe and laying the chickens side by side in the roasting pan. I will definitely make this one again.
This was really good. My family enjoyed it.

This was okay. I didn't honestly taste that much Rosemary from stuffing it inside the chicken. I tasted a little more on the skin from adding some outside. A bit of rosemary that got on my potatoes & carrots outside the bird was more flavorful. Maybe adding Rosemary to surrounding veggies yields greater results?

I made this over the weekend- and it was AMAZING! I did use some of the extra ingredients that other reviewers have mentioned- such as using a little bit of olive oil and lemon juice along w the salt and pepper and rubbing down the chicken- the skin was wonderfully crispy and beautiful while the inside was so juicy! And I also added half a lemon into the cavity along with the onion and rosemary. I also roasted baby red potatoes on the bottom of the roasting pan which I just barely seasoned and drizzled a little olive oil over then- they came out delicious as well! I can't wait to make this again!

I loved this recipe, but my wife thought there was way too much rosemary, and my dog wouldn't touch it. That may now seem germaine, but we feed our dog what we eat (less foods/spices that are taboo for dogs). Next time out, I'll use my own stuffing mix and include only 1 tsp rosemary and 1 tbsp tarragon; 4 slices of rosemary/olive bread, diced small; saute 1 sm onion, 1 stalk of celery and 4-5 cloves garlic (minced) until lightly brown, salt and pepper to taste; 1/4 apple, pealed and sliced thin. To this mix add 1/4 c beer (lager) and 1 shot of Jim Beam. If the mix needs more moisture, I add milk as needed. With these proportions, everyone in my family is happy and nothing is wasted but the bones. I love Italian food/recipes, but that was just outrageously over rosemaried for us.
Add lemon and garlic so easy to make tastes amazing
Delicious & simple recipe! I have made it several times & my family loves it! I added potatoes, carrots and chicken bouillon for more flavor.

This is so simple and delicious! I just used chicken breasts and covered them in onions and rosemary. I added it to my salad today and it was amazing. Tonight I will make chicken salad. I really need to watch my sodium intake and was so happy to find a recipe that is simple and delicious without all the soups, etc. Thank you!
This is my go-to chicken recipe. I use the same one for turkey, adjusting cooking time. It's super easy and delicious. Homegrowm rosemary makes a huge difference compared to dried rosemary.
2 out of 3 of my kids do not like chicken. All of them loved this!!
This turned out very bland. The texture of the chicken was good, but the flavor was unimpressive. Next time I'll try it with some more seasoning.

This dish was delicious and succulent. I followed the recipe to the tee with the following exceptions. In addition to salt and pepper on top of the chicken, I also added a sprinkling of garlic salt and pepper. I also used a blend of fresh garlic, rosemary, thyme, and sage herbs to add inside the cavity of the bird, in addition to sweet onion. I followed other reviewers recommendations and placed fresh rosemary right under the skin of the chicken and added chicken broth to the bottom of the roasting dish. While roasting I basted the chicken every 25 - 30 minutes and also used an injector to further add flavor to the meat of the bird. I cooked it for about 1 1/2 hour and then an additional 30 minutes uncovered to brown the skin. Once done, the meat was so tender and nearly fell apart while carving. It was even more tasty the next day. I highly recommend!

I used olive oil, fresh rosemary, garlic both in cloves and minced over the bird's meat (I removed the skin), a lot of salt and pepper. On the cavity onions, garlic, rosemary, lime, salt and pepper. I added carrots and potatoes an hour before it was done. It turned out spectacular! My family loved it. Highly recommended.

This was the first time I ever roasted a chicken. It was super easy to follow and so delicious. My family was so happy and are already asking when we are having this again. I cooked it at 350 for 2 1/2 hours and the Chicken was super juicy. I rubbed some olive oil on the skin and sprinkled it with salt, pepper, onion powder, garlic salt, and paprika. The skin was crisp and delicious. Can't wait to make again!

I made this tonight for dinner and it was really good. I made some adjustments like putting garlic and Italian seasoning with olive oil on top. I also cut up potatoes and carrots and put around the bottom with the chicken on a rack. Turned out super moist and delicious! Thanks so much!!

This chicken was exceptionally delicious, and very easy to prepare. It was done 'just right'. I added a bit of garlic powder & some chopped parsley into the rub. I love rosemary, especially with chicken, so we loved the flavor. I roasted my chicken in the oven (on a rack over a sheet pan). I had a 5 lb. chicken, so I used my meat thermometer . I roasted the chicken until it reached an internal temperature of at least 155 degs. I then took it out of the oven and (loosly) tented it with aluminum foil (while I was mashing potatoes, and tending to my other side dishes). By 'resting' under the aluminum foil, my chicken reached the safe eating temperature of 165 deg. It was juicy & delicious.

Simple, elegant in its simplicity, this is a wonderful dish to pop on and let bake away in the background on a Saturday afternoon while tending to chores around the house. Lots of room for customizations, but also perfect simply as is.

This was very good. I took suggestions from some other reviewers and added lemon halves and minced garlic to the onions and rosemary I stuffed it with. I also rubbed the outside with the juice from half the lemon, jarred minced garlic and dried rosemary in addition to the salt and pepper. Added chicken stock to the pan and some cut up potatoes and baby carrots. Should have added the carrots later, though, as they shriveled up to tiny sticks. Still tasted good though.

This was very simple and VERY delicious. I only used a pinch of salt and pepper, and will likely use more salt next time. The chicken was juicy and flavorful, and the meat was literally falling off of the bone. I was able to shred leftovers to make chicken sandwiches for lunch, too!

Easy and simple dish...

Great flavor..

I just omitted the onions and added rosemary leaves on the outside ...I used my slow cooker...
Very good. Baked 2 1/2 hours and used an oven bag.
Followed the recipe even added the smashed garlic and lemon to the cavity with the onions and rosemary and cooked it low and slow and the results was delicious.
I was so excited to make this dish and was very disappointed. Very bland and really no flavor at all. I usually like all recipes on this site but this one didn't do it for me.

I made this and to the cavity I added Lemon & crushed garlic besides the Rosemary and Onion. Mine was a 4 1/4 lb Organic chicken. It turned out excellent. My kitchen smelled so good. I followed this recipe pretty much except adding the above additions. We are having the left overs tonight. YUM
Fast and easy to prep. Excellent chicken. Looking forward to trying it on a turkey.

A lot of work. I'd prefer to buy a store bought chicken but the flavour was awesome (I added tarragon) and the meat was very moist. I started at 450 then moved down to 425. Will keep it at 450 next time and it will be done 15 min. sooner.
I made the same recipe but bake it, covered at 415 for 50 minutes; uncovered it for the last fifteen minutes to brown the skin and then serve. Cooking it at a lower temp dries out the white meat.
Stuffing the bird w/herbs may be misleading to some. Stuffing is with a bread stuffing. I like the idea of placing it on a rack so you won'the have a soggy bottom. ??
This was an AMAZING treat for our family! a certain repeat

So simple, so delicious! I rubbed the turkey with a high quality olive oil then sprinkled the rosemary as well as some fine celtic salt over the outside. I didn't stuff the interior. Baked at 350 for 2 1/4 hours and it was perfect! Thanks so much for the recipe ideas!
Great dinner and very easy to prepare, I think I will put some rosemary and butter under the skin next time around as Makanani suggested. Than you!
Delicious! I also stuff some celery in the cavity and add some boullion cubes with it. Makes it taste oh so delish!!!
Delicious. Husband claims it's the best roasted chicken he's tasted.
Loved this recipe. I have made it 3 time already.

This was good but dry. I will make this again. I will do as others and rub butter under the skin. I will also place the rosemary under the skin to get the flavor through the bird. I think you could sub the seasonings to your liking. If you are roasting be sure to add water or chicken broth to the bottom of the pan. I read where some added veggies on the bottom.

Yummy! Added garlic and lemon in the cavity of the chicken. I do not have a pan with a wrack so just added 1/2 cup of chicken stock to the bottom with the onions that could not fit in the chicken. Let stand for 1 hour then roasted. So good! Also, I did not have fresh rosemary, used 1 tablespoon of dried and the dish still came out Yummy! Thanks Allrecipes for such great recipes and great people who leave great reviews on how to make the dish even better! Happy Cooking!
Very fast and big hit for dinner
This is a wonderful recipe for roast chicken.I put a half lemon and 4 cloves of garlic in the cavity, and cut back on the rosemary. Made my kitchen smell wonderful.Thank you for the recipe..

Simple, straightforward recipe for fragrant and juicy roast chicken. I took the advice of other reviewers and added a quartered lemon and crushed garlic to the inside of the chicken before roasting, and also added quartered new potatoes and chunks of carrot to the pan with a bit of chicken stock--good eating. Husband was delighted. A note: I was not a fan of the lingering rosemary flavor when I used the carcass to make chicken stock later that day.

BEST CHICKEN EVER!!! Since it was just my husband & me for thanksgiving we picked up a 4.5lb fryer. I did not have fresh rosemary so I used dried and only other change was I applied bits of butter on the skin which rendered the most delicious skin! The onion keeps the cavity so moist the meat fell from the bones and was delectable! I found letting the bird rest while covered was another good move! Can't wait to make the next one! SIMPLE and DELICIOUS!

This recipe is by far the best for roasted chicken and has been a family favorite which is frequently requested for dinner. I tweaked it as other users had by placing butter and rosemary under the skin as well as stuffing lemon quarters and garlic in the cavity. I receive many compliments along with hugs and kisses when I make this dish!!! Needless to say, this is the only way I will make my roasted chicken.

It was amazing! The juices were succulent. I followed it to the T and added the lemon, garlic using the olive oil then added the potatoes with carrots at the last hour with chicken broth over them and salt and pepper to taste.
This is exactly how I prepare my Christmas turkey!! Absolutely scrumptious!!!
I didn't think this had very much flavor, to be honest.
